message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you this unique opportunity to acquire a product that I know is valuable to your company. My asking price is $1,400,000, which I believe is a fair reflection of its value. I'm confident we can reach an agreement that benefits both of us.
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the product's value.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $1,200,000 is simply too low for me to consider. I'm willing to come down to $1,300,000 to demonstrate my commitment to closing this deal. Let's meet in the middle and see if we can find common ground.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice, but I'm still a bit too far apart. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'll counter with $1,250,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value.

Bob, I appreciate your continued interest in the product, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to go down to $1,350,000. This reflects the significant value this product holds for you. I believe this is a fair compromise, and I'm hopeful that we can reach a final agreement.

I understand your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'll counter with $1,280,000. I believe this is the highest price I can justify considering the product's value.

Bob, we're getting close! I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last offers, at $1,315,000. I truly believe this product will be a significant asset for your company, and I'm confident we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.  Let's finalise this deal!

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still not quite there. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'll counter with $1,300,000. I believe this is the highest price I can justify considering the product's value.
